title: Software Engineer, Space and Airborne Systems
details: Contributed to the development of a cloud-hosted data visualization platform using Python, with Dash and Flask libraries, backed by a Cassandra database and deployed on AWS, enabling secure and scalable access to mission-critical insights.
Developed Windows desktop GUI applications in C++ using MFC for native interface design and event-driven architecture

Spearheaded and managed a project within an Agile environment from initial conceptualization through development to successful internal release and delivery, achieving an 80% reduction in completion time
Managed the projectâ€™s SQL database and implemented new features on the user interface, thereby enhancing the overall user experience and a 30% increase functionality of the project

skills.description: Developed and deployed web applications using Python Dash, Flask, and supporting libraries, integrated with a backend Cassandra database and hosted on AWS to support a distributed data visualization platform for the U.S. Government.

Much of my time at L3 has been spent building Desktop apps in C++ while maintaining an Oracle SQL database. It was during these projects that I was able to find room for improvement enough to show the mentioned 80% improvement.

As part of a recent initiative, I was assigned to a project with the goal of migrating some of our software to the cloud, where customers will be able to configure their own environments with custom data without worrying about the underlying infrastructure. This is built using mainly Python as the programming language, Docker for containerization, Cassandra for the database, and AWS for hosting.

title: Cyber Warfare Officer, 17A
details: Established DevOps plans and tools in support of cybersecurity operations in alignment with a structured strategy to target adversary activities and capabilities
Designed and developed software for embedded systems tailored for small-unit level deployment in tactical environments, enhancing operational efficiency and reliability
Managed and maintained an Active Directory environment, including user/group administration, policy enforcement, and security configurations, ensuring seamless authentication and access control

skills.description: Built several scripts and programs with the intent of building cyber tools for use in an operating environment. With C#, user-friendly GUIs could be easily created using WPF. C/C++ could be used for low-level programming and faster scripting while Python could be used for the extensive libraries.

We must have extensive skills in Docker, Linux, PowerShell, and databases to maneuver around a network with the purpose of finding or exploiting vulnerabilities. As it happens, Linux machines running Docker with a SQL database is a common environments to come across and the easiest to set up training with.
Developed simple model used for detecting anomalous activity within training environment.

title: Mechanical Engineering Intern
details: Tested material properties of silica waveguides as part of the structural and thermal fluids group
Developed various software solutions to streamline data analysis processes and solve simulation problems, reducing data processing time by 35%

skills.description: Used Matlab for simulations and data visualization. Ultimately I led an initiative to have Matlab be used for preliminary simulations using simpler models before sending the more complicated versions to the super computer.
